text: Valentinian III (;In Classical Latin, Valentinian's name would be written as FLAVIVS PLACIDIVS VALENTINIANVS AVGVSTVS. 2 July 419 â€“ 16 March 455), was Roman emperor in the western Roman Empire from 425 to 455. After Attila the Hun was defeated, Valentinian feared that his general Aetius would overthrow him. So, Valentinian killed Aetius, whose guards then killed Valentinian. ==References== Category:5th-century Roman emperors Category:419 births Category:455 deaths
title: Valentinian III
